title: Asiedu Nketia's response to IEA lacks integrity - Baako
text:
Politics | 21 October 2015 13:36 CET Asiedu Nketia's response to IEA lacks integrity - Baako By MyJoyOnline 
Editor-in-chief of the New Crusading Guide Newspaper has taken a jab at the General Secretary of the National Democratic Congress, Asiedu Nketia, describing his response to an invitation by the Institute of Economic Affairs as dishonest. 
The ruling party on Monday took a u-turn hours to an Institute of Economic Affairs (IEA) debate on the electoral roll, although it had confirmed it will send representatives to the event. 
The NDC said by holding an event to discuss the views of various political parties on the register, the IEA was trying to usurp the powers of the Electoral Commission (EC). 
In a statement, the party said the EC would be the only constitutionally mandated institution to collate views about the current voters' register. 
“It is very surprising that the IEA is organizing this debate after it was part of a decision that was taken by the, Ghana Political Parties Programme (GPPP), that the EC should be in-charge of this matter,” the statement said. 
The NDC added that since the EC has opened its doors for submissions from political parties as well as Civil Society Groups, the IEA should direct any concerns they have to the EC. 
But speaking on Peace FM’s morning show ‘Kokrokoo’, Kweku Baako said “Asiedu Nketia’s statement lacks sincerity…it is devoid of honesty”. 
He added “at the point they were accepting the invitation weren’t they aware that the EC is the body mandated to deal with all issues relating to election matters? When they were accepting the invitation and communicating their acceptance in the form of a formal letter to the IEA, was NDC not aware that there had been an agreement with the GPPP that it was only the EC that is mandated to organise debates on the issue?” 
Mr Baako believes that the NDC must have thought extensively about the invitation before replying and accepting to send representatives. 
“There is an honesty and integrity deficit that is driving the statement they issued and in so doing they attack the IEA’s integrity by trying to put IEA in a partisan contest…and this is not the first time they have done that”, he said 
According to the veteran journalist, there is no way the IEA or anyone can replace or substitute the EC, adding, “it doesn’t happen, it cannot happen”. 
In his view, the IEA’s debate will not be a substitute for the EC’s declared forum because it is widely known that the EC’s forum is more critical than any other forum organised concerning the voters register. 
“The idea that only EC is supposed to deal with election matters in the form that they are talking about is surprising and shocking.” 
The NDC, in his view is only creating its own distortion and “they are using that distortion to fight a cause - in my opinion a worthless cause – because IEA hasn’t said its mandate stretches to the EC. That is a creation of someone’s imagination”. 
“But they have deliberately created, manufactured and fabricated it, put it out there so as to sustain the dubious argument that they are pushing across”, he said. 
Story by Ghana | Myjoyonline.com | Naa Sakwaba Akwa | [email protected]
